data.title: Epitome of Automotive Excellence
data.meta_description: Step into the Ferrari Museum in Maranello - a captivating journey through time, history, and the world of legendary speed
data.text:
The Ferrari Museum in Maranello is a shrine to the iconic Ferrari brand, offering a captivating journey through the history and evolution of one of the world's most celebrated automotive manufacturers. Immerse yourself in a world where cutting-edge technology, breathtaking design, and relentless pursuit of perfection have given birth to some of the most legendary sports cars ever created. From the earliest models that laid the foundation of Ferrari's success to the state-of-the-art machines that dominate modern racetracks, the Ferrari Museum is a treasure trove of automotive marvels.

Know Before You Go

Handy information

Must-see at the Ferrari Museum

The Ferrari Hall of Fame

The Ferrari 250 GTO

The Pit Stop

Getting There

Via Alfredo Dino Ferrari, 43, 41053

Maranello - Italy

Get Directions

Opening Hours

Monday to Sunday

June-August: 9 AM - 7 PM

September/October: 9.30 AM - 7 PM

November-March: 9.30 AM- 6 PM

Closed on December 25 & January 01

Why Is Ferrari Museum In Maranello Worth Visiting?

Unveil Ferrari's glorious history through a breathtaking collection of legendary cars.

Experience the thrill of Formula One racing simulations and interactive exhibits.

Witness rare prototypes and limited-edition models, not seen elsewhere.

Marvel at the iconic Prancing Horse emblem, symbolizing Ferrari's unmatched performance.

Get up close to exclusive memorabilia, revealing fascinating stories behind the brand.

Recommended Maranello Ferrari Museum Tickets

Maranello Ferrari Museum History

The Ferrari Museum stands as a testament to the remarkable journey of Enzo Ferrari and his eponymous brand. Founded in 1990, the museum celebrates the legacy of Ferrari, showcasing its innovative engineering and motorsport triumphs. From its humble beginnings in Maranello to achieving unparalleled success on the racetracks worldwide, Ferrari remains an enduring symbol of Italian excellence and passion for automobiles.

With a vast collection of historic and modern cars, the museum preserves the evolution of Ferrari's iconic models, paying homage to legendary vehicles like the Testarossa, 250 GTO, and the modern LaFerrari. It immortalizes the victories of Scuderia Ferrari in Formula One, highlighting the brand's enduring pursuit of speed, precision, and cutting-edge technology.

Maranello Ferrari Museum Architecture

The architectural brilliance of the Ferrari Museum mirrors the elegance and sophistication of the cars it houses. Designed by renowned architect Jan Kaplick√Ω, the museum features a sleek and futuristic structure that pays homage to the aerodynamic lines of Ferrari's iconic vehicles. Inspired by the fluidity of automotive forms, the museum's building boasts a stunning aluminum roof that flows gracefully, resembling the curves of a sports car in motion. The exterior, finished in a vibrant shade of Ferrari Red, emphasizes the brand's signature color.

Inside, the museum exhibits a captivating display of cars, artwork, and interactive installations, all thoughtfully arranged to create a seamless experience. The design emphasizes the harmony between man and machine, capturing the essence of Ferrari's dedication to precision engineering and artistic expression.

Highlights of Ferrari Museum In Maranello

1The Ferrari Hall of Fame

Ferrari museum hall of fame

This section of the museum pays homage to the racing legends and their iconic cars that have brought glory to the prancing horse emblem. Walk through a gallery of Formula 1 championship-winning cars driven by the likes of Michael Schumacher, Kimi R√§ikk√∂nen, and other racing icons. The Hall of Fame showcases not only the cars but also the stories behind these unforgettable victories, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the exhilarating world of Ferrari's motorsport dominance.

2The Ferrari 250 GTO

Ferrari 250 GTO at Ferrari Museum

Undoubtedly one of the most prized and sought-after classic cars in the world, the Ferrari 250 GTO is a masterpiece of automotive design and engineering. The museum houses a rare and stunning example of this legendary model, representing Ferrari's pinnacle of performance and beauty. Standing in the presence of the 250 GTO is a once-in-a-lifetime experience, and it serves as a testament to Ferrari's commitment to crafting exceptional sports cars that have stood the test of time.

3Ferrari's F1 Simulator

F1 simulator at ferrari museum

Experience the thrill of being a Formula 1 driver with Ferrari's cutting-edge F1 simulator. Buckle up and feel the adrenaline rush as you race virtual laps around famous tracks like Monza or Spa-Francorchamps. This interactive simulator replicates the sensation of being behind the wheel of a Formula 1 car, making it an unforgettable experience for motorsport enthusiasts.

4Ferrari's Wall of Champions

wall of champions at ferrari museum

Admire the illustrious lineage of Ferrari's Formula 1 World Champions on the Wall of Champions. This striking display features the names and faces of every driver who clinched a Formula 1 Drivers' Championship title for Ferrari, along with the corresponding championship-winning cars. The wall stands as a testament to Ferrari's unrivaled success in the pinnacle of motorsport.

5The LaFerrari Exhibition

Ferrari Museum exhibitions

Step into the realm of hypercars with the LaFerrari Exhibition, dedicated to showcasing the epitome of Ferrari's engineering prowess. Marvel at the LaFerrari, the brand's first-ever hybrid supercar, boasting a mind-boggling combination of electrifying speed and eco-conscious technology. Learn about its innovative HY-KERS hybrid system, carbon-fiber construction, and aerodynamic design, setting new benchmarks in automotive performance and efficiency.

Best Time to Visit Ferrari Museum At Maranello

The best time to visit the Ferrari Museum is during the spring or fall seasons. The weather is mild and pleasant, ideal for strolling through the museum and exploring Maranello. Avoid peak summer and winter months to avoid crowds and maximize your enjoyment. Arriving early in the day ensures a more immersive experience and ample time to explore the exhibits.

Maranello Ferrari Museum Opening Hours

Open from Monday to Sunday

April/May : 9.30 AM - 7 PM

June-August: 9 AM - 7 PM

September/October: 9.30 AM - 7 PM

November-March: 9.30 AM - 6 PM

Closed On : December 25th & 1st January

Getting There

Insider Tips to Visit Ferrari Museum In Maranello

Arrive early to avoid crowds and make the most of your day.

Combine your museum visit with a factory tour for a comprehensive experience

Arrive early at the museum to avoid crowds and secure your spot in the LaFerrari Exhibition. This exclusive display allows a limited number of visitors at a time to maintain a more intimate and immersive experience with this extraordinary hypercar.

If you're interested in the Pit Stop Challenge, try visiting during weekdays when the museum is less busy. This will increase your chances of participating in the challenge without having to wait in long queues.

Plan to visit the gift shop toward the end of your museum exploration.

Keep an eye on the museum's official website or inquire at the entrance about any special events or temporary exhibitions during your visit.

Restaurants Near Ferrari Museum at Maranello

Ristorante Montana

Ristorante Montana is a charming family-run restaurant known for its warm hospitality and authentic Emilian cuisine. With a focus on locally sourced ingredients, they serve classic dishes such as homemade pasta, delicious risottos, and succulent grilled meats.

Distance from Ferrari Museum: 650 meters

Ristorante Cavallino

Il Cavallino is a restaurant filled with memorabilia, opened by Enzo Ferrari himself. The menu features a mix of Italian and international dishes, making it a great option for those with diverse tastes. Their wood-fired pizzas are a favorite among patrons, while their seafood dishes and homemade desserts also receive rave reviews.

Distance from Ferrari Museum: 600 meters

Ristorante da Emilia

Ristorante da Emilia offers an immersive Italian culinary experience with a menu inspired by Emilian traditions. From regional pasta specialties like tortellini to delectable meat dishes, they take pride in showcasing the authentic flavors of the region.

Distance from Ferrari Museum: 2 km

Panini

Panini is a charming trattoria that offers a delightful culinary journey through Emilian cuisine. Known for its homemade pasta dishes, savory sauces, and locally sourced ingredients, the restaurant prides itself on providing a true taste of the region.

Distance from Ferrari Museum: 2.5 km

Trattoria La Fontana

Trattoria La Fontana takes pride in serving authentic Emilian cuisine, with a menu that highlights the rich flavors of the region. Their dishes are crafted with locally sourced ingredients, ensuring a true taste of traditional Italian flavors.

Distance from Ferrari Museum: 1 km

Places to Stay Near Ferrari Museum in Maranello

Things to Do Near Maranello Ferrari Museum

Enzo Ferrari Museum

Located in nearby Modena, the Enzo Ferrari Museum is a must-visit attraction for anyone fascinated by the history of the iconic brand. The museum is housed in the birthplace of Enzo Ferrari and features a striking combination of historical and modern architecture. Inside, visitors can explore a fascinating collection of cars, multimedia displays, and exhibits that offer an intimate look into the life and achievements of Enzo Ferrari. Combine your visit to Ferrari museum Maranello with Enzo Museum in Modena

Distance: 25 km

Maranello Racing Circuit

For racing enthusiasts seeking an adrenaline-fueled experience, the Maranello Racing Circuit is a dream come true. Located in the vicinity of Maranello, this world-class racetrack offers a variety of driving experiences that allow visitors to feel the thrill of speed behind the wheel of high-performance cars. Several reputable companies provide the opportunity to drive Ferraris, Lamborghinis, and other exotic sports cars on the track, delivering an unforgettable driving experience.

Distance: 650 meters

Modena Cathedral

A short drive from Maranello, the Modena Cathedral is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and an architectural masterpiece. The cathedral's impressive Romanesque facade features intricate carvings and stunning sculptures, making it a true gem of medieval architecture. Inside, visitors can marvel at the magnificent 12th-century rose window, elaborate frescoes, and a grand crypt housing the remains of Saint Geminianus, the patron saint of Modena.

Distance : 16.6 km

Pavarotti House Museum

For music enthusiasts, a visit to the Pavarotti House Museum is a delightful addition to the itinerary. Located in the town of Modena, this museum is the former residence of the world-famous opera singer, Luciano Pavarotti. Visitors can step into the world of the beloved tenor as they explore the rooms filled with memorabilia, personal belongings, and the rich history of Pavarotti's life and career. The museum provides a touching tribute to the legendary singer and his contributions to the world of opera.

Distance: 11.7 km

Panini Motor Museum

Located in Cittanova, a short drive from Maranello, the Panini Motor Museum is a hidden gem for automotive enthusiasts. This private collection is a testament to the passion for vintage cars and motorcycles, offering a captivating journey through the broader history of automotive excellence.The museum features an extensive collection of classic cars, vintage motorcycles, and rare vehicles from various prestigious brands. Notably, the museum showcases an impressive array of Maserati cars, a brand deeply rooted in the history of Italian automotive heritage.

Distance: 16.2 km

FAQs
